title: Program Manager, Security GRC (Third Party Security Risk)
content:
Who we are
About Stripe
Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.
About the team
The Stripe Security team is dedicated to improving the security of Stripe and its users. Our users trust us with some of their most sensitive information, and we make security a first-class consideration in everything we do. Security concerns are ever-evolving, creating an extremely dynamic environment for the Security team.
The goal of the Security GRC team at Stripe is to provide information security advice and operational structure to the Security organization and its customers, both internal and external to Stripe. The team is responsible for various functional areas, including Security Governance, Risk, Compliance, Go-To-Market security support, Security Awareness, and Third Party Security Risk Assessment (TPSRA). 
The Security GRC Program Manager position will be part of Stripe’s CISO pillar and will have the ability to influence the continuous buildout of the Third Party Security Risk Assessment (TPSRA) program including developing policies, standards and processes to support the program.
What you’ll do
Responsibilities

Manage the Third Party Security Risk Assessment (TPSRA) program operations, including assessments, creating awareness amongst the Stripe community, and resolving inquiries from Stripe users
Function as the Third Party Security Risk management subject matter expert supporting cross-functional teams looking to onboard third parties in processes that interact with Stripe’s data
Develop security policies and standards for assessing Third Party Security Risk
Operationalize strategic security programs by making them efficient, scalable, and reliable
Identify Third Party Security Risk program gaps and drive the implementation of recommended mitigations
Partner with cross-functional stakeholders to identify, analyze and mitigate Third Party Security Risks associated with outsourced activities and products
Operate autonomously leading large-scale efforts across multiple teams and functions, with stakeholders across different time zones
Formalize and streamline the Third Party Security Risk program processes to improve SLAs and provide better customer service. Develop, define, and report on the program’s health and success metrics to provide insights to management to help drive strategic direction
Support the completion of the information security review process for all new third parties and annual reviews for all other relationships that receive and/or interact with Stripe data

Who you are
We’re looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.
Minimum requirements

Strong background in cyber security operations, risks and controls identification and assessment
Working technical knowledge of security, as well as industry trends
Subject matter expert in cyber and information security practices, policies, standards and procedures (e.g. NIST CSF or equivalent)
Experience implementing and operating programs for Security Compliance, IT Compliance, Information/Cyber security or Security Risk Management
You have experience driving mid to large-scale projects and programs from start to finish within highly complex operating environments
You have strong written and verbal communication skills, building strong relationships at all levels of the organization from executives to project teams
Knowledge of how to use data to influence program strategy and tell compelling stories about organizational effectiveness and impact

Preferred qualifications

Report on program performance via dashboards, OKRs and perform basic data analysis (e.g. SQL, Redshift, Tableau)
Experience working with JIRA, Whistic, Bitsight
Experience working with engineers for the automation of security controls

questions.description: Stripe is currently operating in a hybrid work environment. In-office expectations for office-assigned Stripes vary by team. A remote location, in most cases, is defined as living 50 miles or more from an office location. While you would be welcome to join the office for team or business meetings when necessary, the expectation would be that you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office location. Stripe offices are located in Amsterdam, Bangkok, Bengaluru, Berlin, Chicago, Dubai, Dublin, Jakarta, London, Madrid, Mexico City, New York City, Paris, São Paulo, Singapore, South San Francisco, Seattle, Tokyo, and Toronto. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location in which you live or have intentions to live.
